content.description:
P1: Start below a clean face approximately in the middle of the crag and below a clean arÃªte halfway up the cliff. Up the face past three small pines to a belay at another pine (50 feet; 5.5) 

  P2: Step right and climb a loose corner to big ledges and the top (50 feet; 5.3).
content.location: This cliff is located on the south side of Highway 385, just inside the park boundary. It is just to the east of what was Earl's Gas station. Looking south from Highway 385, this cliff is on the left (east) side of a drainage to the south of the road.

content.description: This is a loose crag with lots of poison ivy at the base. In the 1980s, the gas station just outside (west of) the park boundary was called Earl's Gas, hence the name of the cliff.
